title: Addidas and NIKE World Cup Soccer Jersey Font ID HELP!
content:
Hi-

I'm new to this website, and was hoping someone could help me identify some fonts. I will post an image of the font(s) in question.

Thanks in advance.

Alex
author: azartman

comments.content: And don’t expect too much from the future answers: See [FAQ #16](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012190101/http:/typophile.com/forum/typeid/faq/#Q_16).

Need help? [How to post a sample or image](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012190101/http:/typophile.com/node/18067)  
In particular, make sure that:

- the file name does not contain spaces (or any other ø∂∂ ¢håræct€rs)
- you have the right [Flash plugin](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012190101/http:/www.adobe.com/products/flashplayer/) installed with your browser

Here are images of Brazil and the USA's tops. Both of their kits are from Nike.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012190101im_/http:/typophile.com/files/USA_uniform_6339.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012190101im_/http:/typophile.com/files/brasil_uniform_5398.jpg)
  
(I'm curious as to the name of font too)

Interesting, we haven't had the Nikes yet. I'm curious too.  
The FontFeed has recently covered Adidas (Unity, custom by Yomar Augusto) and also Puma (Crepello, custom by Paul Barnes):  
 [http://fontfeed.com/archives/world-cup-typography-yomar-augusto/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012190101/http:/fontfeed.com/archives/world-cup-typography-yomar-augusto/ "http://fontfeed.com/archives/world-cup-typography-yomar-augusto/")  
 [http://fontfeed.com/archives/world-cup-typography-paul-barnes/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012190101/http:/fontfeed.com/archives/world-cup-typography-paul-barnes/ "http://fontfeed.com/archives/world-cup-typography-paul-barnes/")

Note, all these are custom design jobs so I wouldn't expect any of them to become available for licensing.
